result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamaya E Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kamaya E Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kamaya E Jones was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Kamaya E Jones was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 3, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 6 months.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 1, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute sobriety.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
Complete mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Restitution hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Restitution is held open.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamaya E Jones

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 11 FOR BRANCH 40:
Defendant Kamaya E Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Kamaya E Jones.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 3, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 159 days time served.
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 6 months.  
- Provide a DNA sample

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 1, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence in COUNT 3 and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation. 

Conditions of Probation AS TO COUNT 3:
- 30 DAYS condition time in the HOC imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- Complete mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 18 months.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Restitution is held open.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

FIled:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case is adjourned for Restitution hearing. Court authorized the defendant to appear by zoom or phone on the next scheduled court date.
Restitution hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea

Defendant Kamaya E Jones in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Kamaya E Jones in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 5 SUPERVISION.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Kamaya E Jones not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Plea and sentencing remains scheduled on August 9, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Branch 40, Room 634 CH.  Case adjourned.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court.  Defendant Kamaya E Jones not in court, in custody at the House of Correction.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Dennis Murphy.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a bail/bond hearing and plea/sentencing hearing.  Court set the matters as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kamaya E Jones in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Kamaya E Jones in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Kamaya E Jones in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Kamaya E Jones in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamaya E Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
